00078 #include "zesto-cache.h"
00079 
00080 /* memory controller */
00081 class MC_t
00082 {
00083   struct MC_action_t {
00084     bool valid;
00085     void * op;
00086     seq_t action_id;
00087     md_paddr_t addr;
00088     int linesize;
00089     int MSHR_bank;
00090     int MSHR_index;
00091     enum cache_command cmd;
00092     struct cache_t * prev_cp;
00093     /* final call back on service-complete */
00094     void (*cb)(void * op); /* NULL = invalid/empty entry */
00095     /* extract action_id; varies depending on whether we're dealing with a uop or IFQ entry */
00096     seq_t (*get_action_id)(void *);
00097     tick_t when_enqueued; /* cycle this transaction arrived in the MC */
00098     tick_t when_started;  /* cycle the MC sent this transaction to the DRAM */
00099     tick_t when_finished; /* cycle the dram access completes */
00100     tick_t when_returned; /* cycle the MC returned this request to the CPU */
00101   };
00102 
00103   protected:
00104   counter_t total_accesses;
00105   counter_t total_dram_cycles;
00106   counter_t total_service_cycles;
00107 
00108   void init(void);
00109 
00110   public:
00111   MC_t() {};
00112   virtual ~MC_t() {};
00113   virtual bool enqueuable(void) = 0;
00114   virtual void enqueue(struct cache_t * const prev_cp,
00115                        const enum cache_command cmd,
00116                        const md_paddr_t addr,
00117                        const int linesize,
00118                        const seq_t action_id,
00119                        const int MSHR_bank,
00120                        const int MSHR_index,
00121                        void * const op,
00122                        void (*const cb)(void *),
00123                        seq_t (*const get_action_id)(void *) ) = 0;
00124   virtual void step(void) = 0;
00125   virtual void reg_stats(struct stat_sdb_t * const sdb);
00126   virtual void reset_stats(void);
00127   virtual void print(FILE * const fp) = 0;
00128 };
00129 
00130 MC_t * MC_from_string(char * const opt_string);
00131 
00132 /* since these cannot directly set the core->oracle.hosed bit, they
00133    just return and depend on the rest of the core state getting hosed
00134    to force a reset. */
00135 
00136 #ifndef zesto_fatal
00137 #ifdef DEBUG
00138 #define zesto_fatal(msg, retval) fatal(msg)
00139 #else
00140 #define zesto_fatal(msg, retval) { \
00141   fprintf(stderr,"fatal (%s,%d:MC): ",__FILE__,__LINE__); \
00142   fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",msg); \
00143   return (retval); \
00144 }
00145 #endif
00146 #endif
00147 
00148 #ifndef MC_assert
00149 #ifdef DEBUG
00150 #define MC_assert(cond, retval) assert(cond)
00151 #else
00152 #define MC_assert(cond, retval) { \
00153   if(!(cond)) { \
00154     fprintf(stderr,"fatal (%s,%d:MC): ",__FILE__,__LINE__); \
00155     fprintf(stderr,"%s\n",#cond); \
00156     return (retval); \
00157   } \
00158 }
00159 #endif
00160 #endif
00161 
00162 #endif /* ZESTO_MC_INCLUDED */
